module.name: Paris Relay controller
module.description: With this VSCP module it is possible to control up to seven relays.

reg.name: Zone
reg.description: Zone this module belongs to

reg.name: Subzone
reg.description: Subzone this module belongs to

reg.name: Relay 1 status register
reg.description:
Writing a value to the relay control register will activate/deactivate the relay output.
 0 - The relay is inactivated.
 1 - The relay is activated.
 2 - The relay is pulse activated/deactivated (opposite form rest state).
 Reading a value from the relay control register is read as a one if the relay is activated and a 0 if the relay is deactivated.
 When the pulse activation/deactivating is used the actual relay state is read. That is, if a 2 is written to relay 1 a one will be read while the relay is activated, after which a zero will be read.

item.name: Off
item.description: The relay channel 1 is in its off state or if written set in is off state.

item.name: On
item.description: The relay channel 1 is in its on state or if written set in is on state.

item.name: Pulse
item.description: The relay channel 1 is in its pulsing state or if written set in is pulsing state.

reg.name: Relay 1 control register
reg.description:
The relay control bits enable/disable intelligent relay functionality:
 Bit 0 - Reserved.
 Bit 1 - If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.
 Bit 2 - Protection timer enable.
 Bit 3 - Send On event when relay goes to active state.
 Bit 4 - Send Off event when relay goes to inactive state.
 Bit 5 - Send Started event when relay goes to active state.
 Bit 6 - Send Stopped event when relay goes to active state.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the relay is enabled.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved

bit.name: Protection alarm
bit.description: If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.

bit.name: Protection timer enable
bit.description: If set: Protection timer is enabled and will deactivate relay channel when the timer times out.

bit.name: On event on activate enable
bit.description: If set: An on event will be sent when the relay is turned on.

bit.name: Off event on deactivate enable
bit.description: If set: An off event will be sent when the relay is turned off.

bit.name: Started event on activate enable
bit.description: If set: A started event will be sent when the relay is turned on.

bit.name: Stopped event on deactivate enable
bit.description: If set: A stopped event will be sent when the relay is turned off.

bit.name: Enable relay
bit.description: Set this bit to make the relay controlable.

reg.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 1 MSB
reg.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register.\n

reg.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 1 LSB
reg.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register.\n

The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register.\n

reg.name: Relay protection time register for relay 1 MSB
reg.description: This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

reg.name: Relay protection time register for relay 1 LSB
reg.description: This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

reg.description: This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 1
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 2
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 3
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 4
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 5
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 6
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 7
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Subzone for relay 8
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Oaddr
reg.description: Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: flags
reg.description:
Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.
 The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.
 The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Subzone match
bit.description: If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class mask (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class filter (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Oaddr
reg.description: Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

abstraction.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 1
abstraction.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register. \n

abstraction.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 2
abstraction.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register. \n

abstraction.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 3
abstraction.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register. \n

abstraction.name: Relay protection time register relay 1
abstraction.description:
This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.
 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.
 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

abstraction.name: Relay protection time register relay 2
abstraction.description:
This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.
 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.
 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

abstraction.name: Relay protection time register relay 3
abstraction.description:
This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.
 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.
 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

abstraction.name: Relay protection time register relay 4
abstraction.description:

bit.name: Protection timer relay 8
bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

bit.name: Protection timer relay 7
bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

bit.name: Protection timer relay 2
bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

bit.name: Protection timer relay 1
bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

action.name: Activate relay(s)
action.description: Activate relay(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is relay 1 and so on.\n Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.\n

param.name: Bitarry for relay
param.description: A bitarray where the first bit represents relay one and so on.

bit.name: Relay 1
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 1

event.name: On Event
event.description: A relay has been set in its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating relay n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the relay or if it is zero to the subzone for the module..

event.name: Off Event
event.description: A relay has been set in its OFF position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating relay n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the relay or if it is zero to the subzone for the module..

event.name: Started Event
event.description: A relay has been set in its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating relay n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the relay or if it is zero to the subzone for the module..

event.name: Stopped Event
event.description: A relay has been set in its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating relay n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the relay or if it is zero to the subzone for the module..
